intro: Seseli albescens, commonly known as white seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, white flowers are clustered in flat-topped umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Seseli albescens is often found in calcareous soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
